decks.notes: The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and creatures like Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of cards like Isochron Scepter and Force of Negation helps to maintain control over the game, while cards like Solitude and Supreme Verdict provide board control against aggressive decks. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium and Monumental Henge to provide additional advantages.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing mana acceleration and high-impact Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, the deck aims to control the pace of the game while grinding out advantages with cards like Kozilek's Return and Sowing Mycospawn. With a mix of removal, ramp, and big threats, the deck looks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in the late game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. These creatures, such as Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, can be brought back at instant speed to surprise and overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes cards like Leyline Binding and Force of Negation to protect these reanimation spells and ensure the combo can go off smoothly. Additionally, there are cards like Psychic Frog and Fallaji Archaeologist to provide card advantage and control the board.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes versatile spells like Seasoned Pyromancer and Thraben Charm to maintain board control. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer adds additional pressure to the opponent. The deck aims to create a fast-paced, aggressive game plan to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent and controlling the board by using cards like Thoughtseize, Prismatic Ending, and Fatal Push. It also leverages the Death and Taxes strategy of taxing the opponent's resources while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Emperor of Bones. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate to generate value from enter-the-battlefield effects. The inclusion of graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and versatile removal options allows the deck to adapt to various matchups in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to control the pace of the game. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also being able to deploy efficient threats like Flickerwisp and Emperor of Bones, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their strategy. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play quickly, while cards like Solitude and Witch Enchanter provide additional removal and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck relies on a combination of instant and sorcery spells to disrupt opponents while utilizing powerful creatures and artifacts to quickly win the game without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare to counter opponent's spells, and cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Goblin Charbelcher to deal damage directly to the opponent, the deck aims to create a fast and overwhelming win condition. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention help to accelerate this strategy, creating a unique and aggressive combo-focused playstyle.
